bibl.title: Amphora Stamps: 1997-2001.

series.title: Excavations at Akoris in Middle Egypt.

bibl.note: P. V: H.K. and Sumiyo TSUJIMURA, Preface. - I. General View (H.K.). - II. Archaeological Excavation (H.K.). - III. Stamped Amphora Handles (Rhodian: 275; Nikandros Group: 6; Koan: 4; Knidian: 4; Miscellaneous Greek: 45; Italian: 19) (Y.S.). - IV. Historical Perspectives (1. The tomb of Petosiris and the introduction of Greek amphorae in Middle Egypt [an extended version will be published in: Journal of School of Letters, Nagoya University 1 (2005)]; - 2. A Greek architraval inscription at Hermopolis [I. Hermoupolis 1] [first published as: Social Context of an Architraval Inscription at Hermopolis. Further Thoughts on the Text and Politics in the chora of Ptolemaic Egypt, SITES. Journal of Studies for Integrated Text Science 2 (2004) pp. 1-9]; - 3. A rock-cut dedicatory inscription for Ptolemy V in Akoris [O.G.I.S. I, 94 = I. Akoris 1] [abridged version of: Texts and Local Politics in the chora of Ptolemaic Egypt: The Case of OGIS 94, SITES. Journal of Studies for Integrated Text Science 1 (2003) pp. 1-12] (Y.S.). - Bibliography. Index of Personal Names on Amphora Stamps.
bibl.seg: KAWANISHI Hiroyuki and Yoshiyuki SUTO, Amphora Stamps: 1997-2001. (Excavations at Akoris in Middle Egypt. I.)
Tsukuba (Ibaraki, Japan), Akoris Archaeological Project, 2005, 4Â°, viii-208 pp., figg., profils, cartes, plans.
